page.title: 18KINLOSS SCHOOL, MARTLEY
page.content: {Laughern House}is a fine Georgian country house standing in{6 acres}of its own grounds within the valley of the{Teme River. Between 1955 and 1978 the Infant Department of the{Royal School for the {Deaf}operated a school on the site. The premises was next occupied by a mixed residential group of maladjusted children,{Laughern House School. In January 1985{Kinloss School}took over the site, having moved from a smaller premises in Southampton. The headmaster is Mr. Tuohy. The boys at Kinloss range from 11 to 17 years of age, and all have learning difficulties of a{"dyslexic"}nature. One of the boys comes from the West Indies just for the school term. Most weekends the boys go{camping}or do outdoor pursuits, but can go home occasionally by arrangement.
